reg.title: Hotel Room Tax Regulation for the City of Richmond
reg.amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 167/2012, June 25, 2012]

section.sectiontext: In this regulation, Act means the Hotel Room Tax Act.
September 30, 2009 is the prescribed date after which section 3 of the Act applies in respect of accommodation purchased in the City of Richmond.
The tax payable under section 3 (1) of the Act is 2% of the purchase price of accommodation purchased in the City of Richmond.

section.marginalnote: Prescribed purposes for expenditure of tax
section.sectiontext: The City of Richmond may spend the amount paid to it out of the revenue collected from the tax for

paragraph.paragraphtext: sport hosting marketing, programs and projects, and
improvements to the Richmond Olympic Oval intended to enhance its attraction as a tourist destination.

content.regnote: Note: this regulation replaces B.C. Reg. 432/2004.

footnote.footnotetext: See section 45 of the Provincial Sales Tax Transitional Provisions and Amendments Act, 2013, S.B.C. 2013, c. 1

content.provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Hotel Room Tax Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 207, section 43 (2) (e) and (f)]
